2:
No, in your inner beings you think only about doing what is wrong,
\q2 and you commit violent crimes everywhere in this land of Israel.
\q1
3:
Wicked people do wrong things and tell lies from the time that they are born.
\q1
4:
What wicked people say injures people like the venom of a snake.
\q2 They refuse to listen to commands; it is as though they were deaf cobras.
\q
5:
As a result, like a snake that does not respond when a charmer plays a flute or when someone sings magic songs,
\q2 they do not pay attention when others rebuke them.
\b
\q1
6:
God, as for these enemies who want to attack me like young lions,
\q2 break the teeth in their mouths!
\q1
7:
Cause them to disappear as water disappears in dry ground!
\q2 Cause the arrows that they shoot to have no heads!
\q1
8:
Cause them to become like snails that disappear in the slime;
\q2 cause them to be like a baby that is born dead!
\b
\q1
9:
I hope that you will get rid of them
\q2 as fast as thornbushes are blown away after they are cut.
\q1
11:
Then people will say, "It is true that there is a reward for righteous people;
\q2 and there is indeed a God who judges people justly here on the earth!"
58:
\d A psalm written by David for the choir director, to be sung using the tune "Do not destroy."
\b
\q1
